section.name: Merry Christmas
section.p: Another Christmas, another time to have fun. Before parties, feasts and strip dancers, let's keep everything together because it is right the time to review the year 2004.

subsection.name: Beginning of 2004
subsection.p: Tough days extended to the year 2004. For us, food = Burgerking, house = classroom and transportation = jogging.

subsection.name: First job in US
subsection.p: Was it amazing? Finally I got a job in VA. It was time to say good bye to old friends and start an unexpected experience.

subsection.name: Then... Dallas again
subsection.p: In Virginia, I... Wait a minute, this is still Dallas. I see, I worked so efficiently that I moved back to Dallas in less than 2 months to take the second job.

subsection.name: Time to relax
subsection.p: Before switching to the new job, I would like to one thing I always dream about ---- sleeping in a park bench for a whole day.

subsection.name: June
subsection.p: About this, I would say... en... I have nothing to say.

subsection.name: I cook, you eat
subsection.p: Alright, let's make it crazy. Can you believe it? A barbacue in midnight, 11:40PM. Who cares? It's Oklahoma anyway.

subsection.name: Life makes sense now
subsection.p: Suddenly I realized that "enjoy life" does mean something.

subsection.name: End of story
subsection.p: One day I was too happy. It wasn't too bad for me. I guess this is it.

subsection.name: Happy end
subsection.p: It turned out I was wrong. Everything is still fine.

section.p: Finally it's Christmas again. Things changed a lot in this year. Let's look forward to the year 2005.
Thanks for spending time on this crap. Merry Christmas and happy new year.
